Class ProudCoreAPI

java.lang.Object
it.proud.api.ProudCoreAPI
public final class ProudCoreAPI extends Object
Central access point for the ProudCore plugin API.

This class exposes a thread-safe singleton that grants external plugins unified access to all ProudCore subsystems: clan management, custom characters, player data, and scoreboards. The instance is created and registered by ProudCore itself during startup; external code must never instantiate this class directly.

Lifecycle

  1. ProudCore constructs an instance via the constructor.
  2. ProudCore publishes it globally via register(ProudCoreAPI).
  3. External plugins retrieve it at any time with get().
  4. On server shutdown, ProudCore calls unregister() to release the instance.

Typical usage

ProudCoreAPI api = ProudCoreAPI.get();

IClanManager       clans   = api.getClanManager();
ICharManager       chars   = api.getCharManager();
IPlayerManager     players = api.getPlayerManager();
IScoreboardManager sb      = api.getScoreboardManager();

Safe usage (optional dependency)

ProudCoreAPI api = ProudCoreAPI.getOrNull();
if (api != null) {
    // ProudCore is available â€” proceed safely
}
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • ProudCoreAPI

      public ProudCoreAPI()

  • Method Details

    • register

      public static void register(ProudCoreAPI api)
      Publishes the given ProudCoreAPI instance as the global singleton.
      Parameters:
      api - the fully-initialised instance to publish; must not be null

    • unregister

      public static void unregister()
      Retracts the global singleton and signals that ProudCore is shutting down. This method is a no-op if the API was never registered.

    • get

      public static ProudCoreAPI get()
      Returns the global ProudCoreAPI instance.
      Returns:
      the current, non-null instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the API has not been registered or has been unregistered

    • getOrNull

      public static ProudCoreAPI getOrNull()
